pimu background|pim background|history o: The Public Investment Management Unit (PIMU) was established in 2018 at The National Treasury. It was formed after diagnostic studies by the World Bank and IMF (AFRITAC East) conducted in 2016, 2017, and 2018 recommended its creation.
pim guidelines|pim circular|when were pi: The Public Investment Management (PIM) Guidelines were issued in 2020 through National Treasury Circular No.16/2019. They guide all MDAs and County Governments in managing public investment projects.
pim mandate|mandate of pim|roles of pim|: The mandate of PIM includes: Formulating and reviewing PIM policies and laws, building PIM capacity in national and county governments, designing and maintaining PIMIS, developing standards for project appraisal (PCN, PFS, FS), and reviewing/appraising proposed public investment projects.
pim objectives|objectives of pim|purpose: The objectives of PIM guidelines are: Provide a standard approach to project cycle management, improve project identification and planning, guide feasibility and appraisal, support budgeting, monitoring, evaluation and reporting, ensure transparency and accountability, and strengthen prudent use of public resources.
scope of pim|who uses pim guidelines|whe: PIM Guidelines apply to: National and County Governments, all public investment projects (fully or partially funded), PPP projects, and all projects managed through PIMIS.
what is pimis|define pimis|pimis meaning: PIMIS (Public Investment Management Information System) is a government system that automates the full public investment project lifecycle — including submission, review, appraisal, approval, budgeting, monitoring, and reporting.
pimis mandate|role of pimis|functions of: PIMIS is designed to automate public investment management processes, maintain a national pipeline (Bank of Projects), track implementation progress, and provide a public-facing portal for transparency and monitoring.
public investment management|what is pim: Public Investment Management (PIM) refers to the systematic process of planning, appraising, selecting, budgeting, implementing, monitoring, and evaluating public investment projects.
bank of projects|project pipeline|pipeli: The Project Pipeline (Bank of Projects) is a national repository of approved, ready-for-financing projects managed under PIMIS.
pimis urls|official urls|system links|lo:
Official PIMIS URLs:
• LIVE System: https://pimis.treasury.go.ke
• TRAINING Environment: https://pimisdev.treasury.go.ke
Ensure you select the correct environment before logging in.
supported browsers|browsers|devices|syst: PIMIS works on Safari, Firefox, Chrome, Edge, and Opera. Supported devices include PC, Laptop, Tablet, and Mobile (iOS/Android). Recommended browsers: Latest Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.
login failing|cant login|unable to login: Login may fail due to: Wrong URL (Live vs Training), incorrect or case-sensitive password, Caps Lock on, or account lock after multiple failed attempts. Use Password Reset or contact Help Desk.
reset password|forgot password|change pa:
To reset your PIMIS password:
1. Click 'Forgot your password?'
2. Enter your email
3. Check for the reset link (valid for 30 minutes)
4. Create a new strong password
5. Log in again.
no reset email|did not receive email|no: If you did not receive the reset email: Check spam/junk folders, wait 2–3 minutes, confirm the correct email was entered. If still missing, raise a Help Desk ticket.
create pcn|project concept note|pcn proc:
Steps to create a Project Concept Note (PCN):
1. Click 'Create PCN'
2. Enter required information
3. Save
4. Upload attachments
5. Submit
6. Forward/Return as required.
pre feasibility|pre-feasibility|create p: To create a Pre-Feasibility Study: Open 'Create Pre-Feasibility', fill required sections, save your work, upload documents, then submit and forward for review.
feasibility study|detailed feasibility|c: To create a Feasibility Study: Click 'Create Feasibility', complete all required analysis (economic, social, financial, technical), save, upload attachments, submit, and follow approval workflow.
pipeline|project pipeline|why still in p: Projects remain in Pipeline if they have approved PCNs and are awaiting funding or the next required stage.
save and forward|cannot forward|mandator: You cannot Save & Forward unless all mandatory fields marked with an asterisk (*) are completed.
dashboard|dashboard summary|what dashboa: The PIMIS dashboard displays: Total projects, pending actions, budget summary in KES, progress charts (pie & bar), and alerts depending on your role.
menu missing|cant see menu|missing menu|: Menu visibility depends on Role-Based Access Control (RBAC). Different roles see different menus. MDAs and Counties only see modules relevant to their responsibilities. Contact an administrator if a module is missing.
